intro: Draba simmonsii, commonly known as Simmons' whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky, dry environments such as mountain slopes and gravelly soils. Draba simmonsii is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient member of alpine and arid ecosystems.
